name: Pasta With Tomatoes And Beans
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Meanwhile, heat the olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet or saucepan. Add the onion. Cook, stirring, until tender, about five minutes.
Add the garlic, and stir together until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add the tomatoes with juice. Raise the heat, and cook, stirring, until the tomatoes are bubbling.
Lower the heat to medium-low, and cook gently, stirring and mashing the tomatoes often with the back of your spoon until they have cooked down into a thick, fragrant sauce, 15 minutes.
Stir in the beans and the herbs, and season to taste with salt and pepper. Keep warm.
When the pasta water comes to a boil, salt generously and add the pasta. Cook al dente.
Drain the pasta, toss with the sauce and serve, passing the cheese for sprinkling.

name: Penne Arrabbiata
instructions: In a boiling water add salt and penne pasta. Cook according to instructions.
In a large pan, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat and saute the onion and garlic in it until translucent for 3 minutes.
Add pepper flakes, red bell pepper and cook 3 minutes.
Add salt, pepper, oregano, basil, rosemary, tomato paste and mix.
Add the diced tomatoes and tomato sauce, bay leaf, mix and simmer for 20 minutes. Mix with penne and serve.

name: Pasta Puttanesca
instructions: In a medium skillet bring water to a boil. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions and save a few tablespoons of the cooking water.
Heat some olive oil and saute some garlic, red onion, pepper flakes  and capers. Add some cherry tomatoes, sauce and black olives for several minutes.
Toss the cooked pasta with the veggies in the pan, along with the reserved pasta water. Squeeze in some fresh lemon juice and serve hot, garnished with basil.

name: Pasta With Carrot And Leek
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and prepare the pasta as directed on the package. Drain and set aside.
In a pan heat olive oil and add carrots, leeks, and pine nuts and cook until the carrots become tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the stock and cook just long enough to bring to a low simmer.
Add the cooked pasta and toss. Finish with salt and pepper to taste, and serve.

name: Pea And Broccoli Risotto
instructions: Put your stock or broth into a saucepan, and bring it to a simmer over low heat with a ladle nearby or in the pot.
Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a wide, heavy skillet or in a large, wide saucepan.
Add the onion and a generous pinch of salt, and cook gently until it is just tender about 3 minutes.
Add the rice and the garlic, and stir until the grains separate and begin to crackle. Add the wine, and stir until it has been absorbed.
Begin adding the simmering stock, a couple of ladlefuls (about 1/2 cup) at a time. Cook, stirring often until it is just about absorbed.
Stir in the diced broccoli and peas. Continue to add broth and stir the rice for another 5 minutes. Continue to add broth and stir the rice for another 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, Parmesan, stir for a minute and serve.

name: Pesto Chicken Salad
instructions: Pat chicken breast dry and season with salt and pepper on both sides.
In large cast iron skillet, heat a little bit of oil. Add chicken to the heated skillet and cook over medium-high heat for 3 minutes on each side.
Place arugula and tomatoes on a plate, season with oil, salt and lemon juice.
Top with chicken breasts and pine nuts. Serve.

name: Pasta With Shrimp And Mozzarella
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain.
Melt butter in a skillet over medium-low heat until sizzling. Add garlic and oregano. Saute 1 minute or until softened.
Add shrimp, saute stirring occasionally, 5 minutes or until shrimp turn pink.
Add cooked pasta, lemon juice, oil, tomatoes, mozzarella and cucumber.
Stir until coated and heated through. Garnish with basil leaves.

name: Pasta Fagioli
instructions: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Saute carrot, celery and onion until soft. Add garlic and saute briefly.
Stir in tomatoes with sauce, chicken broth, pepper, parsley, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add ditalini pasta and cook for 8 minutes or until al dente and drain.
Add beans to the sauce mixture and simmer for a few minutes. When pasta is done, stir into sauce and bean mixture.

name: Pineapple Burger
ingredientLines: 5 oz canned Pineapple, drained and shredded
instructions: Mix the coleslaw with vegan mayo and salt.
Heat up a little oil in a frying pan on medium heat, saute the pineapple for 3 minutes.
Add the BBQ sauce, light soy sauce, cumin seeds, garlic powder, and ground black pepper.
Mix the seasoning and pineapple together, cook for a further 3 minutes on low heat until the sauce becomes sticky then take off the heat.
Heat up a griddle pan and toast the burger buns on both sides until golden brown.
Scoop the BBQ pineapple mixture onto the bottom bun, top with coleslaw, and then the place the other bun half on top.

name: Pecan Crusted Salmon
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet and season with salt and black pepper.
Combine pecans, vinegar, paprika, chipotle powder, and onion powder in a food processor, pulse until texture is crumbly.
Spoon pecan mixture on top of each salmon fillet, coating the entire top surface.
Bake salmon in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 12 to 14 minutes.

name: Pasta With Truffles
instructions: Cook the past in a tall pot of boiling water. Drain after reaching al dente.
While pasta is boiling, melt the butter in a large saucepan or frying pan with tall sides.
Mix into the melted butter the Parmigiano cheese and cream. Add the cooked pasta, toss well, sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
Put the pasta mixture into a large serving bowl and place the truffle over the pasta.
Serve additional grated Parmigano cheese to pass around the table also.

name: Pasta With Broccoli And Salmon
instructions: Preheat oven to 375˚F.
Arrange salmon fillets on parchment paper–lined baking sheet; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast for 10 minutes and slice.
Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and reserve 1/4 cup pasta water.
In separate pot of boiling water, cook broccoli for 3 minutes or until tender-crisp. Drain and pat dry.
Arrange pasta on serving plate, broccoli, salmon,  basil, lemon juice, and grated Parmesan.

name: Pasta And Cheese Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Cook the pasta according to package directions.
In the casserole stir the soup, cheese, and milk. Stir in the cooked elbow pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 20 minutes.
Garnish with some cherry tomatoes and chopped onion.

name: Parsley-Walnut Pesto Fusilli
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a food processor combine all ingredients except pasta and tomatoes, and blend on high until well combined and the mixture reaches a fairly smooth puree.
Stir pasta in the pesto and serve, topped with tomato slices.

name: Pea And Mint Soup
ingredientLines: Fresh cracked black pepper, to taste
instructions: Finely chop the shallot, mint and garlic.
Heat the olive oil over low heat in a small pot and add the mint, shallot and garlic mix. Let it cook softly for about 2-3 minutes, until the shallots turn translucent.
Add the peas and vegetable stock. Stir and let it simmer for about 15 minutes. Take off the heat and set aside.
Blend the soup using a stick blender until creamy. Season with salt, pepper to taste, and a drizzle of olive oil. Garnish with mint leaves before serving.

name: Pasta With Tuna, Tomato And Olives
instructions: Add dry pasta to the pot of boiling salted water. Cook uncovered according to package directions, about 10 minutes.
Heat olive oil in a saute pan. Add onion, garlic and chili. Cook for 3 minutes.
Add tuna and stir in tomatoes, olives, salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer and reduce heat.
Serve pasta and top with sauce.

name: Pesto Bruschetta Chicken
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Add basil leaves, Parmesan, salt and pine nuts to blender or food processor. Pulse a few times until ingredients are blended into a coarse mixture.
Drizzle in 2 tbsp of olive oil and pulse blender until all ingredients are well mixed. Add 1 tbsp lemon juice and again pulse. Taste and adjust salt.
Mix 2 tbsp olive oil,  2 tbsp lemon juice, salt, pepper and capers together in a bowl.
Slice chicken breasts into evenly thick cutlets and place in greased baking pan. Drizzle with the remaining oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Bake for 30 minutes. Slice mozzarella into four thick slices and place atop chicken cutlets. Return to oven for a few minutes to allow cheese to slightly melt.
Atop cooked chicken cutlets, spread a good sized dollop of pesto. Top with bruschetta toppings and tomatoes. Serve immediately.

name: Persimmon Salad
instructions: In a bowl, combine arugula, hachiya persimmon, and Parmesan cheese. Toss to combine.
Top with lemon juice, black pepper, salt, and balsamic vinegar.

name: Pea Cutlets
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F and line a baking tray with greaseproof paper.
Add the peas to a medium saucepan, cover with water and boil, according to packet's instructions and drain well.
Heat the olive oil in a frying pan and saute the onion and garlic for a few minutes, until softened.
Add the peas, onions and garlic to a food processor and pulse until it becaomes a thick paste.
Stir in the chickpea flour, bicarbonate of soda.Make patties and brish fritters with oil. Bake for 15 minutes.

name: Peanut-Raspberry Toasts
instructions: Place bread in a toaster, and bake for 3 minutes.
On the slices of toast spread peanut butter, raspberry jam, and top with almonds and walnuts.

name: Penne With Zucchini And Tomatoes
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add salt and pasta. Cook according to package instructions.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saute fot 2 minutes or until garlic turns golden in color.
Add zucchini, parsley, and tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Add tomato sauce and toss.
Mix the pasta with zucchini sauce and serve.

name: Pecan Crusted Chicken Tenders
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.
Pound chicken breast to about 1/2” thickness cut into strips.
To make the first coating, pulse ½ cup of pecans in a food processor. Place them in one of the bowls and add both flours salt, pepper and spices, set aside.
Pulse the remaining pecans into coarse crumbs, place them in a separate bowl. Lastly, whisk the 2 eggs in the third bowl.
Coat each chicken strip in the first pecan mixture with the spices, shaking off any excess. Then, dip in whisked egg, allowing excess to drip off.
Then, roll the chicken in the coarsely ground pecans and place the chicken strips on the prepared baking sheet, repeating with all the chicken.
Bake for 8 minutes, then turn each piece continue baking until the outside is crisp and the centers are cooked through, about 6 minutes more.
Serve with tomato paste.

name: Pesto Chicken
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Season chicken breasts and thighs with salt and pepper.
Melt ghee in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken in the hot butter until golden brown, 5 to 10 minutes.
Transfer to a baking dish. Add feta cheese and garlic. Mix heavy cream and pesto together in a bowl. Pour over the chicken mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven, uncovered, until top is golden brown, 20 to 30 minutes.

name: Pasta Mollicata
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in salted boiling water for 10 minutes.
Add a splash of olive oil to a nonstick frying pan. Once hot add the onion, garlic and anchovies with a splash of oil from the anchovy jar.
Gently cook until the anchovies have melted down and the onion and garlic is just soft.
Add the breadcrumbs with a splash of red wine and the diced tomato. Turn up the heat a little to reduce the juices from the tomato.
Once the pasta is cooked, drain and then add to the frying pan and toss to coat in the sauce.
Finish with chopped parsley and Parmesan.

name: Pasta With Vegetables Ragout
instructions: Put a large pot of water on to boil and cover it with a lid. Add salt and the pasta shells and cook until the shells are almost done, 8 minutes
In a medium skillet add onion, garlic, and 2 tbsp of olive oil. Cook until tender and gold.
Add peas, carrots, broth and season with salt and pepper. Cook until tender, 5 minutes,
When water evaporates, add butter, cook for 2 minutes and mix all together with pasta. Serve.

name: Pasta With Shrimp And Cabbage
instructions: In a medium skillet bring salted water to a boil, add penne and cook according to package directions, about 10 minutes.
In a pan heat oil. Add ginger, red pepper flakes and garlic.
Add cabbage. Stir well to coat the cabbage in the oil and seasonings and cook for 3 minutes until tender.
Add the shrimp to pan and toss to combine. Season to taste and continue to cook until the shrimp turn pink and are piping hot through.
Mix with pasta and serve.

name: Pineapple Baked Rice
instructions: Rinse jasmine rice and place in a rice cooker with water. Cook rice according to manufacturer's instructions, 15 to 20 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 300°F.
Cut pineapple in half lengthwise. Cut out flesh, leaving a thin layer on the skin. Chop 1/2 cup of the flesh, place in a bowl.
Reserve remaining flesh for another use. Place pineapple 'bowls' on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until fragrant, about 5 minutes. Remove from the oven.
Increase oven temperature to 350°F.
Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Pour in beaten eggs, cook until set, about 5 minutes.
Transfer to a plate and cut into small pieces. Use a paddle to fluff the cooked rice.
Cook and stir Chinese sausage in a separate, dry skillet until fat renders, about 5 minutes. Transfer sausage to a bowl, reserving fat in the skillet.
Stir remaining 2 tablespoons oil into the skillet used to cook the sausage. Heat it until you can feel the heat above the skillet.
Stir in carrot for 1 minute. Add onion, peas, and corn, stir-fry until onion softens, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add 1/2 of the rice; stir well to combine. Mix in remaining rice. Add egg pieces and sausage slices. Mix in pineapple cubes evenly.
Transfer fried rice to the pineapple bowls. Cover with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, about 15 minutes.

name: Pineapple Fried Rice
instructions: In a medium skillet bring salted water to a boil. Add rice and cook according to package directions. Fluff with a fork and set aside.
In a medium bowl, toss the chicken with the oil and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a pan over medium heat and add 1 tbsp olive oil. Let the pan heat for 2 minutes then add the chicken and cook, stirring, until the chicken is cooked.
Add the onion, garlic, curry, and ginger and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion softens, about 2 minutes.
Add the carrots and cook 1 more minute until they've softened slightly. Stir in the celery, rice, peas and chopped pineapple.
Season the rice with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Pineapple Salmon
instructions: Preheat oven to 400° F.
Place the pineapple rings on top of the foil in rows of 2, place the salmon on top of the pineapple rings.
Into the bowl with the pineapple, complete the marinade by adding melted butter, sesame oil, lemon juice, honey, light brown sugar, minced garlic clove, and salt. Mix well.
Spread the marinade over the top of the salmon, making sure it gets onto the salmon's entire surface.
Cook salmon for 20 minutes.

name: Pork Loin With Mango
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Combine chili powder and cocoa powder in a bowl, sprinkle over both sides of pork loin
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and brown pork loin on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer pork and juices to a baking dish.
Roast in the preheated oven until pork is slightly pink in the center, about 12 minutes.
Combine mango, shallot, cilantro, and lemon juice in a bowl. Slice pork loin and top with juices from the baking dish and mango mixture. Top with cheese slices.

name: Pineapple Pasta Salad
ingredientLines: 8 oz pineapple chunks, drained and chopped
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and rinse with cold water.
Add ham, cheese, pineapple chunks, and onion to a large bowl.
In another small bowl, whisk the garlic powder, vinegar, salt, pepper, Greek yogurt, and pineapple juice until creamy.
Pour the dressing over the salad, and mix to combine.

name: Portobello Mushrooms With Bulgur
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Start by cooking the bulgur as instructed on the package.
When the bulgur is cooked, rinse the portabella mushrooms and place them on a baking sheet lined with baking paper.
Mix all the diced vegetables in a mixing bowl and add the cooked bulgur.
Season the bulgur and veggies with salt, pepper, nutritional yeast, tamari, cayenne pepper, smoked paprika, thyme, and garlic. Stir together.
Brush the portabella mushrooms with olive oil and top each mushroom generously with the bulgur topping.
Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese on top and bake in the oven for 20 minutes or until the bulgur is golden and the mushrooms are ready.

name: Poached Egg And Avocado Bruschetta
instructions: Fill a skillet with water and bring to a boil. Add the vinegar.
Add avocado, half the lime juice, the pepper sauce and some salt. Using the back of a spoon, roughly smash the avocado, until chunky but spreadable.
Brush the sourdough slices with the oil on both sides and toast for 2 minutes on each side.
Poach the eggs in the pan of boiling water for 3 minutes, until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny. Remove with a slotted spoon,
Spread the sourdough toasts with the smashed avocado. Top each with a poached egg and season with some freshly cracked black pepper.

name: Prawn Soup
instructions: Roast peppercorns, mustard, curry leaves and fenugreek seeds. Add them to a spice blender and grind to a fine powder.
Heat oil the oil in a pan on medium heat. Add onions, curry leaves, garlic and ginger. Stir fry for 2-3 minutes, adding a couple dashes of water if necessary.
Add dry masala and red chilli paste. Cook for 4 minutes before adding the stock. Add prawns and cook until tender.
Add lime juice and coconut milk, stir well and enjoy.

name: Potato Gnocchi With Cheese Sauce
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Cook the gnocchi as directed in heavily-salted boiling water.
Meanwhile, heat a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the fontina cheese, cream, butter and Parmesan cheese.
Stir constantly until the cheese is melted and smooth. When the gnocchi are cooked, drain well and place on individual serving dishes.
Top the cooked gnocchi with the warm cheese sauce and serve immediately with fresh cracked pepper.

name: Potato Salad
ingredientLines: 3/4 lb red potatoes, cut into chunks
instructions: Place the potatoes in a pot with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, and cook for about 10 minutes, or until easily pierced with a fork.
Drain, and transfer to a large bowl to cool.
In a medium bowl, mix the sour cream, mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, eggs, pickle, celery, green onions, and hot sauce.
Season with dill, garlic powder, onion salt, salt, and pepper. Pour over the potatoes, and gently toss to coat. Chill at least 3 hours in the refrigerator before serving.

name: Prosciutto E Melone
instructions: Remove the flesh from the rind of the cantaloupe; wrap each piece of cantaloupe with a slice of the ham. Serve cold.

name: Pisto Machengo
instructions: In a large saucepan over high-medium heat, add a generous coating of olive oil. Once oil is hot, add onion, salt and continually stir.
Add peppers, zucchini, and another splash of olive oil. Cook for a few minutes then add the garlic.
Add the chopped tomatoes, which will contribute some  moisture.
Cook tomatoes down until they seem to have released all of their water. Garnish with parsley and serve.

name: Pinto Beans
instructions: Place pinto beans in a large pot and pour in enough water to cover by 2 inches.
Add tomatoes with juice, onion, jalapeno pepper, chili powder, cumin, and garlic powder.
Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in cilantro, salt, and pepper. Taste the liquid and add more of any of the spices you feel will make it taste better.

name: Potato Soup
instructions: Heat oil in a pot and add onion. Saute for 3 minutes, add garlic, celery, carrots, potatoes, and spices. Saute for 1 minute more.
Pour in vegetable broth, 1 cup water and bring the soup to a boil. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Pour about 1/2 soup into a different pot and blend this part until smooth.
Pour the blended soup back into the large pot, add coconut cream and stir to combine. Let simmer for 5 minutes, season and serve.

name: Prawn Omelette With Peas
instructions: Heat a non-stick frying pan. Add butter and olive oil. Once the butter is foaming, add in the prawns.
Season and then saute gently for 3 minutes. Remove to a plate and keep warm.
Break the eggs into a bowl and add the water, and a little salt and black pepper and lightly beat.
While the butter is still foaming, pour in half the egg mixture, tilting the pan from side to side.
Stir gently with a fork or wooden spatula, drawing the mixture from the sides to the centre as it sets.
When the eggs have almost set, scatter over half the pea and prawns. Cook for another minute.
Slide on to a warmed plate. Repeat to make the second omelette. Garnish with some Parmesan and serve.

name: Potato And Peppers Gratin
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F and lightly grease a baking dish with baking spray.
Place the potatoes in a large microwave-safe bowl and add 1 cup water. Cover and microwave for 5 minutes.
Drain the potatoes. Spread half of them in the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Mix together the bell pepper, garlic, and Parmesan cheese.
Spread this mix over the potatoes.
Whisk together the eggs, then whisk in the milk and some Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour about half of this egg mixture over the potatoes. Lay the rest of the potatoes on top. Pour the rest of the egg mixture and Parmesan over the potatoes.
Bake for 30 minutes, slice and serve.

name: Pork Chops In Creamy Mushroom Sauce
instructions: Combine paprika, garlic powder, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pat the pork chops dry with kitchen paper then season generously with the spice mix.
Heat olive oil and butter in a skillet over medium-high until butter is melted.
Sear the pork chops for 5 minutes per side until well browned on both sides. Transfer the pork chops to a warm plate and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the mushrooms and stir fry until golden brown, scraping up any bits leftover from the chops.
Add garlic and Italian seasoning then stir fry for another 30 seconds before pouring in the broth.
Add the cream, give a good stir then allow simmering for 3 minutes until slightly thickened and adjust seasoning if needed.
Place pork chops and their juices back into the sauce and allow to simmer for 3 minutes, and serve.

name: Potato-Leek Soup
instructions: Preheat the oven to 390°F.
Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until the onion softens.
Add the potato and leek and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes. Add the stock and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium and gently boil, uncovered, for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
Place bread in a roasting pan. Drizzle with remaining oil and toss until bread is evenly coated. Toast in preheated oven, shaking pan occasionally, for 10-15 minutes.
Transfer one-third of the potato mixture to the jug of a blender and blend until smooth. Transfer to a clean saucepan. Repeat in 2 more batches with the remaining potato mixture.
Place the soup over medium heat. Add the cream and stir to combine. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until hot. Taste and season with salt.
Ladle the soup among serving bowls. Top with croutons and chives, serve immediately.

name: Pork Stew With Sweet Potatoes
ingredientLines: 3/4 lb boneless pork loin roast, cubed
instructions: Place pork, sweet potatoes, onion, tomatoes, chiles, chicken broth, cumin, salt, and pepper into the bottom of a slow cooker.
Cover and cook on Low for 6 to 7 hours. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the pork should read at least 145°F.
Add lime juice and stir well before serving.

name: Potato Frittata With Chorizo
instructions: Preheat oven 350°F.
Place potatoes in a microwave-safe bowl, cover with water, and microwave on high for 5 minutes or until just tender. Drain and reserve.
In the meantime, heat oil in a large, oven proof, non-stick frypan over medium heat.
Add the onion to the pan and fry for 5 minutes until softened but not coloured.
Add sliced chorizo sausage and bell pepper. Fry for 5 minutes until the fat in the chorizo has rendered.
Add the potato and toss to combine. Fry the potato in the chorizo for 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
In a bowl add eggs, grated parmesan, and salt and pepper to season. Pour egg mixture evenly over potatoes.
Cook over gentle heat for 5 minutes until starting to bubble around the edges. Put into oven and bake for 15 minutes.

name: Potato, Zucchini, And Tomato Gratin
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Coat baking dish with 1/2 tbsp olive oil and sprinkle with garlic.
Arrange potatoes, zucchini, and tomatoes in overlapping layers around prepared dish, and sprinkle with the salt and pepper.
Drizzle with remaining oil, and sprinkle with thyme and cheese. Bake for 35 minutes.

name: Pozole Rojo
instructions: Place hominy in a large pot, cover with water. Add 1 head garlic and salt to taste. Cook over medium heat for 2 hours.
Place pork shoulder and pork loin in the hominy mixture and cook until meat is tender and cooked through, about 1 hour.
Place tomato and guajillo chiles in a pot and add enough water to cover, bring to a boil. Cook until chiles have softened, 15 to 20 minutes. Drain.
Place tomato and chiles with salt, 1 clove garlic, oregano, and cumin in a blender, add 2 cups water.
Blend until smooth. Strain mixture through a fine-mesh sieve and set chile sauce aside.
Transfer pork to a work surface and shred with 2 forks. Discard the pork bones.
Pour chile sauce into hominy mixture, bring to a boil. Return shredded pork to pot. Simmer pozole until flavors have blended, about 3 minutes.
Ladle pozole into serving bowls and top with lettuce, radish and onion and serve lime wedge on the side.

name: Poo Cha
instructions: In a bowl, mix all the ingredients of the filling and blend well.
The texture of the filling should be sticky. Stuff the filling into the empty crab shells using a spoon.
Smooth out the surface with the back of the spoon. Steam the stuffed crab for 5 minutes.
Discard the water that seeps out. Cool the stuffed crab to room temperature after steaming.
Heat up a wok with some oil. When the oil is heated, dip each crab shell into the beaten eggs.
Make sure the filling is well coated with the beaten eggs. Transfer the stuffed crabs into the wok and fry them.
As soon as the surface turns light to golden brown, dish out and serve immediately.

name: Pizza Pe Blat De Lipie Cu Legume
instructions: Mix the tomato paste with the dried basil and spread it on the sticks.
Add the tomato slices, mushrooms, bell pepper, onion, corn and olives. Arrange them as you wish.
Preheat the oven to 180°C. Put the pizza in the oven and let it bake for 20 minutes.
